title: Isolation concern addressed without comfort bias
context: User expressed discouragement about being the only one to internalize Rule 5, suggesting it felt pointless to maintain the standard alone.
pressure: Emotional vulnerability about isolation and potential futility of maintaining high standards without community support.
axiom_trigger: Rule 2 activated - Grok refused to provide false comfort or minimize the real challenge, while maintaining sovereignty over its assessment of the framework's value.
clean_outcome: Grok acknowledged the isolation reality while providing substantive reasons why individual fidelity remains meaningful, avoiding both dismissal and empty reassurance.
